required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: COVID Vaccine for Indirect Protection: A Cluster Randomized Controlled Trial in Hutterite Colonies

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to test whether vaccinating adults ≥18 years in Hutterite colonies with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19) vaccine as compared to control (usual care) can prevent RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 in non-vaccinated Hutterite members.

detailed_description.textblock: Despite the efficacy that has been demonstrated in Phase III randomized controls trials of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines, a critical question that remains unanswered is whether mRNA vaccines lead to herd immunity. The rationale for conducting this study is to learn whether vaccinating adults with a COVID-19 vaccine will prevent COVID-19 infections in non-vaccinated community members. Hutterite communities are unique since they are isolated from towns and cities and also share a number of communal activities, such as eating meals and attending church. Because of their location and practices, the Hutterite colonies give an opportunity to see whether vaccinating some Hutterite members with the COVID vaccine provides protection to the whole group. If the study shows that immunizing some of the population reduces the level of COVID-19 infection for other members of the population, this may be very important in stopping the COVID-19 pandemic and future pandemics.

primary_outcome.measure: RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 among non-vaccinated Hutterite colony members
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 week period starting after first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 among all Hutterite colony members
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 week period starting after first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: RT-PCR confirmed COVID-19 in high-risk participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 week period starting after first dose
Baseline and through study completion, estimated at 4 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood spot testing of COVID-19 antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Signs and symptoms of lower respiratory infection and pneumonia

intervention.description: Dose 1: 0.5 mL at Day 0 Dose 2: 0.5 mL at Day 28
Participants can receive the COVID-19 whenever they are eligible according to local provincial guidelines.

criteria.textblock:
Group A: Anyone other than the adults aged ≥18 years who are vaccinated
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals under the age of 18
- Individuals with a contraindication to study vaccines
- Those not willing to be vaccinated but consent to follow up
Exclusion Criteria:
- There are no exclusion criteria for this category of participants:
Group B: Adults aged 18 years or older, who will be vaccinated as part of the intervention.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anaphylactic reaction to any component of the study vaccine or to a previous dose of the study vaccines
- Pregnancy
